skill.name: replicate-handler
skill.description: Integrate with Replicate AI for running models (image generation, LLMs, etc.).
skill.summary: Integrate with Replicate AI for running models (image generation, LLMs, etc.).
skill.author: AayushBaniya2006

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only TypeScript type definitions and usage guides for the official Replicate SDK. No executable code, no network operations, no file system access. Safe for publishing.

content.value_statement: Running AI models requires correct API integration and type safety. This skill provides TypeScript definitions and documentation for the Replicate SDK so you can call image generation, LLMs, and other models with confidence.
actual_capabilities: Run AI models with replicate.run() for quick tasks
Create and manage predictions with the predictions API
Handle long-running model tasks with Inngest polling
Train custom models using the trainings API
Type-safe integration with full TypeScript definitions
Stream model outputs and handle webhooks
limitations: Does not include the actual replicate npm package
Processing time varies by model complexity
API rate limits apply based on your Replicate plan

use_cases.title: Add image generation
use_cases.description: Integrate Stable Diffusion, FLUX, or other image models into your web application.

use_cases.title: Deploy LLMs
use_cases.description: Run large language models like Llama, Mistral, or custom fine-tuned models via API.

use_cases.title: Build AI features
use_cases.description: Create background processing for video generation, embeddings, or custom AI workflows.

prompt_templates.title: Quick image generation
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate an image with a simple prompt
prompt_templates.prompt: Use replicate.run() to generate an image with model 'stability-ai/sdxl' and prompt 'a sunset over mountains'

prompt_templates.title: Check prediction status
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I poll a prediction until it succeeds using step.run() in an Inngest function?

prompt_templates.title: Train a custom model
prompt_templates.scenario: Fine-tune a model with your data
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to use replicate.trainings.create() to fine-tune a model with custom training data

prompt_templates.title: Handle errors
prompt_templates.prompt: Write code to handle prediction failures, check error messages, and implement retry logic

output_examples.input: Generate a product photo using the FLUX model with a white background
output: âœ“ Initialized Replicate client with your API token
âœ“ Input: product photography prompt with white background
âœ“ Result: Your generated image URL

best_practices: Store REPLICATE_API_TOKEN in environment variables, never in code
Use AbortSignal for cancelable predictions to avoid wasted resources
Implement webhook handlers for production deployments instead of polling
Handle prediction errors gracefully with try-catch blocks
anti_patterns: Hardcoding API tokens in source files or commit messages
Ignoring prediction status and assuming immediate results
Not setting timeouts on long-running model calls
Skipping error handling for network failures during inference

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Claude Code, and Codex. The TypeScript definitions work in any JavaScript or TypeScript project.

faq.question: What are the rate limits?
faq.answer: Rate limits depend on your Replicate pricing tier. Free tier has lower limits; paid tiers offer higher throughput.

faq.question: Can I use this with Next.js or other frameworks?
faq.answer: Yes. The Replicate SDK works with any JavaScript framework. Use server-side code to protect your API token.

faq.question: Is my data sent to Replicate servers?
faq.answer: Yes. Input prompts and files are sent to Replicate for processing. Review their privacy policy for details.

faq.question: Why is my prediction timing out?
faq.answer: Large models like video generators take longer. Use Inngest or webhooks for tasks over 30 seconds.

faq.question: How is this different from calling the API directly?
faq.answer: The SDK handles authentication, pagination, streaming, and type safety. Less boilerplate, fewer errors.
